Activity: Wake up, have a coffee and review personal notes on statistical arbitrage strategies and potential technological bottlenecks.
Log in to the system, check emails and prioritize tasks for the day. Respond to urgent requests or queries.

Deep dive into the existing technology infrastructure documentation to identify areas for improvement and scalability to support statistical arbitrage strategies. Research best practices for low-latency data processing and trading infrastructure.
Draft an initial outline for the technology infrastructure plan. Focus on key components: data ingestion, storage, processing, trade execution, risk management, and monitoring.
Lunch. Take a break from the screen, maybe read an article on high-frequency trading or distributed systems.

Refine the technology infrastructure plan outline based on the morning's research. Start documenting specific technology choices (programming languages, databases, messaging queues, etc.) and their rationale.
Email @devops-1 and @qres-1 to schedule a brief meeting to discuss infrastructure requirements for data ingestion and processing. Include preliminary thoughts on cloud vs. on-premise solutions.
Review the day's progress and adjust the plan for the rest of the week. Document open questions and areas requiring further investigation.
End of workday. Consider personal reading on distributed consensus algorithms.
